Timeline: The coming year (starting 2026), leading up to July 4th
Expected Impact/Value: A straightforward display of America's fractured state, with two rival national commissions planning events; metaphor for partisan battleground in politics/history.

Entity/Subject: Audit of American History at federal sites and Smithsonian museums
Timeline: Executive order issued March 2025; results/actions likely in 2026
Expected Impact/Value: To extol American greatness and extirpate 'divisive narratives,' leading to the removal of exhibits related to slavery at national parks.

Key Player/Organization: Donald Trump, foreign ministers from Egypt, Saudi Arabia, and the UAE (potential actors)
Expected Impact/Value: A quick, dirty, Trump-backed truce is possible, but unlikely to lead to lasting peace; potential deal to carve up Sudan's minerals (gold) and grant power sharing, ignoring civilians.
Less effective (12.4%-16.6% weight loss vs 16-23% for jabs) but far more convenient, leading to a growth in options.

Timeline: 2026 (attention turns to it; phase-three trials due end of 2025)
Expected Impact/Value: Dubbed the 'Godzilla' of weight-loss medicines; 24% body weight loss over 48 weeks demonstrated in phase-two trials (needs replication in phase-three).

Entity/Subject: CagriSema (combination of Wegovy and amylin analogue)
Expected Impact/Value: Demonstrated a 23% loss in phase-three trials.
Seems to offer a 20% weight loss after a year.

Entity/Subject: Bimagrumab (antibody drug to increase skeletal muscle mass) combined with semaglutide
Expected Impact/Value: Delivers 22% weight reduction after 72 weeks (93% fat loss, compared to 72% with semaglutide alone).

Timeline: 2026 (in many markets, but not America and Europe)
Expected Impact/Value: Generic manufacturers will be able to make cheap copies and expand availability in countries like Brazil, China, and India. Potential to save 2.1m-3.1m lives a year globally if available to all with obesity and diabetes.

Entity/Subject: Review of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA)
Key Player/Organization: United States, Mexico, Canada (under Donald Trump)
Expected Impact/Value: Decision on extending the deal for a further 16 years; could be 'ugly' negotiations focused on rules of origin for vehicles, China's role in supply chains, and non-tariff barriers (e.g., dairy, energy policy). Disruption would raise prices and undercut regional competitiveness.

Entity/Subject: Economic, financial, and social consequences of AI
Key Player/Organization: Global businesses, AI firms, S&P 500 investors
Expected Impact/Value: The focus will shift from technological feats to real-world consequences; key indicator to watch is the rate of formal AI adoption by companies. Failure of adoption could cause AI stock valuations (P/E ratio 31 vs 19 for overall index) to deflate, wiping away trillions in wealth.

Entity/Subject: End of post-cold-war era of international development / Dramatic curtailing of aid spending
Key Player/Organization: USAID (dismantled by Donald Trump), 17 largest Western donors, OECD
Expected Impact/Value: Aid spending by 17 largest Western donors may be more than 25% lower in real terms than in 2024. Sub-Saharan Africa will be the worst-affected region; rough estimates suggest Trump's cuts put 1m lives at risk globally.

Entity/Subject: Consequences of Donald Trump's economic policies (tariffs, deficits, low migration, Fed assault)
Timeline: 2026 (clarity about upending the economy will arrive)
Expected Impact/Value: Consequences will probably show up clearly in GDP and inflation figures. Americans will notice higher prices (tariffs making goods scarcer, low immigration limiting labour). Possible economic sugar-high from government spending/easier Fed policy might obscure full impact.

Timeline: 2026 (risk most likely to start in markets)
Expected Impact/Value: AI boom has stretched valuations; a crash could wipe away trillions of dollars in American households' wealth, seriously crimping spending.

Key Player/Organization: US government, Federal Reserve (Jerome Powell's retirement in May 2026, potential replacement with easy-money lackey)
Timeline: 2026 (conceivable risk, could crystallize around Fed chair replacement in May)
Expected Impact/Value: A severe, momentous crisis for the world's main issuer of safe assets, driven by fears of an inflationary default or financial repression.
China, already dominant in solar panels, wind turbines, and advanced batteries, increases influence as Trump cuts green subsidies and berates foreign governments for shunning fossil fuels.

Entity/Subject: Tariff-free access for African imports to China
Key Player/Organization: China (Xi Jinping), African nations (53 of them)
Timeline: 2026 (extended by China after Trump slapped 30% tariffs on South Africa)
Expected Impact/Value: Increases China's influence in Africa, contrasting with American protectionist policies.

Entity/Subject: India's engagement with China and Russia (Shanghai Co-operation Organisation meeting)
Key Player/Organization: Narendra Modi (India), Vladimir Putin (Russia), Xi Jinping (China)
Expected Impact/Value: India edged closer to America previously; Trump's actions (demeaning Modi, punitive tariffs for buying Russian oil) pushed Modi to embrace China/Russia, despite India's suspicion of the grouping.
Trump lowered tariffs in exchange for China agreeing to buy soyabeans and advanced chips from America, and to sell rare earths (all trades that suit China).

Entity/Subject: Supreme Court rulings limiting Presidential power
Expected Impact/Value: Courts put guard-rails around the president's ability to decide when to declare an emergency; presidency looks much less imperial than it seems now (e.g., restricting deployment of National Guard, constraining ICE).

Entity/Subject: Bipartisan deal on immigration (pairing asylum law changes with increased high-skilled migration and more guest worker visas)
Key Player/Organization: Donald Trump, US Congress (Republicans and centrist Democrats)
Timeline: 2026 (possible scenario, after closing southern border to irregular migration in first year)
Expected Impact/Value: The bill passes, despite resistance from MAGA immigration restrictionists.

Entity/Subject: Increased investment and expanded capacity for solar and wind power
Key Player/Organization: Trump administration (cutting financial regulation, easing permitting), private investors
Expected Impact/Value: Generating capacity from solar energy increases; wind power benefits from higher investment and expanded capacity.
Tariffs settle at a rate higher than pre-Trump, but some predictability returns. Supreme Court helps by returning some power over tariffs to Congress.
Intended to appease foreign donors; far more likely to inflame country's many civil conflicts than tame them.

Key Player/Organization: Abiy Ahmed (Prime Minister), ruling Prosperity Party
Expected Impact/Value: Expected to be farcical; all chief rivals co-opted or imprisoned. Outcome could be scuppered by new war due to long-running insurgencies in Oromia/Amhara, or rising tensions with Eritrea over Red Sea ports.

Entity/Subject: Grand Theft Auto VI (GTA VI) launch
Timeline: November (of 2026, inferred from context of 'coming year' which is 2026)
Expected Impact/Value: Expected to shatter sales records; analysts predict sales of more than $3bn in its first year, making it perhaps the single most valuable launch in entertainment history. Will boost console sales and may prompt an overdue price increase in software.

Entity/Subject: Global consumer spending on games growth
Expected Impact/Value: Predicted to edge up by just over 2% (after growing less than 1% in 2025).

Entity/Subject: Software consumption driven by Switch 2 console launch
Timeline: First two years following June launch (which Ampere data supports being in 2025, thus 2026 is the second year)
Expected Impact/Value: Will drive $7bn-$ 8bn of software consumption.
Adds real-life avenues for the hobby, focused on America and Britain.
Not in source

To undermine Ukraine's defence by escalating threat perception among Europeans, forcing them to prioritise their own rearmament over supporting Ukraine. Includes cyber-attacks, sabotage, and drones over countries like Poland, Germany, and Denmark.
Europe will spend more on defence than at any time since the cold war; rows expected over where extra money for defence and Ukraine will come from, as American contribution has dried up.

Entity/Subject: State elections in Saxony-Anhalt and Mecklenburg-Vorpommern
Key Player/Organization: Alternative for Germany (AfD), Christian Democrat Union (CDU)
Timeline: September (2026, based on context of 'coming year')
Expected Impact/Value: A stern test for Germany's electoral 'firewall' against the hard-right AfD. If AfD wins an outright majority in either, it would be a 'political earthquake' across Europe.

Exports to the rest of the world surged by 11% in the first nine months of 2025. Germany's annualised trade deficit with China was approaching $100bn by late 2025. If surge continues, it will trigger a panic over de-industrialisation in the West and more tariffs on Chinese goods. BYD plans to have 2,000 stores in Europe by late 2026.

Entity/Subject: Aggressive grey-zone campaign against Taiwan (e.g., customs-inspections regime, short of embargo)
Key Player/Organization: China (Xi Jinping), People's Liberation Army (PLA), Donald Trump
Timeline: 2026 (conditions may be better than any point in living memory for aggressive campaign)
Expected Impact/Value: Could have unpredictable effects in the Trump era by triggering a regional arms race by American allies afraid of abandonment, due to Trump's ambivalence about defending the island.

Proposal to create new global rules on finance, AI, climate, and space, including a worldwide compulsory-licensing scheme for rare earths. Unpopular in democracies that fear dependency on autocratic China.

Entity/Subject: China's next five-year plan on AI roll-out (called 'AI+')
Expected Impact/Value: A three-stage roll-out: widespread AI use in six areas by 2027; AI as widespread as electricity/internet by 2030 (big driver of economic growth); and becoming an 'intelligent society' by 2035. Focus in 2026 will be on rapid adoption and adding AI to existing workflows, tailored to scenario-specific models.

Key Player/Organization: Huawei (Ascend chips), Cambricon, MetaX, Chinese government
Expected Impact/Value: Chinese suppliers' share could exceed 50% of the market (which will be $71bn by then), up from two-fifths ($ 38bn) in 2025. Driven by government barring firms from using Nvidia's chips and Chinese designs improving performance/efficiency (e.g., adopting fp8 data format).

Entity/Subject: Local production of AI chips (using older ASML tools)
Expected Impact/Value: SMIC plans to double capacity for chips at 7nm or below. Chinese fabs will turn out millions of AI chips, enough to cover much of domestic demand, despite lower yields than TSMC. A profound shift that shows America's attempts to hobble China are failing.

Key Player/Organization: Pop Mart (company making the doll, based in China)
Timeline: 2025 (became a worldwide sensation), 2026 (cartoon series in the works)
Expected Impact/Value: Underlines extent to which Chinese creativity is making its way into mainstream Western consciousness. Pop Mart share price increased 400% over the past year.

Entity/Subject: Expansion of Chinese brands into Western markets
Timeline: 2026 (expected to see new brands in cities worldwide)
Expected Impact/Value: Mixue and Chagee opening shops in America and elsewhere. Part of a revolution in creative IP production supported by the CCP.

Timeline: March 2026 (will be released, guiding government from 2026 to 2030)
Expected Impact/Value: Guaranteed to focus on: breaking technological 'strangleholds' (self-reliance), clean-energy projects and grid investments (emissions likely peaked in 2024), and tackling plummeting fertility rate (aiming to be a 'truly family-friendly society').

Key Player/Organization: Gulf countries, Donald Trump (aiming to keep fuel prices low)
Expected Impact/Value: World will be 'swimming in petroleum' as Gulf countries restore output, keeping prices subdued (unless a fully enforced American blockade against Russian oil occurs).

Key Player/Organization: Investors (retail and central banks), political uncertainty, high inflation in America
Expected Impact/Value: May well exceed $4,500, buoyed by instability, after surging past $4,000 an ounce in 2025.

Key Player/Organization: Global economy (hit by tariffs), electric car sales, Chinese factories
Expected Impact/Value: Will continue to be buffeted by volatile forces. Hit by tariffs and stronger dollar, but boosted if global electric car sales accelerate fast enough to devour vastly more copper, or if Chinese factories bounce back.
Fell by 5% (despite companies promising to invest to revive US manufacturing base).

Entity/Subject: iPhone manufacturing shift for US-bound products
Expected Impact/Value: Aims to move most of its American-bound iPhone manufacturing from China to India (as companies accelerate moving production out of China due to tariffs/chaos).

Key Player/Organization: Pharmaceutical firms (Bristol Myers Squibb, Eli Lilly), Nvidia, tariff-struck firms
Expected Impact/Value: Rose by 12%. Pharma giants and Nvidia are on track to spend twice as much on lobbying in 2025 as in 2024, fretting about 2026.

Entity/Subject: Brazilian General Election (presidential, vice-president, senators, governors, congress members)
Key Player/Organization: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, centrist coalitions, right-wing governors (Tarcísio de Freitas, Ratinho Júnior, Ronaldo Caiado)
Timeline: October 2026 (if no candidate receives more than 50% on Oct 4th, run-off on 25th)
Expected Impact/Value: May mark the return of moderation after a decade of polarisation, with candidates having to win over consolidating center-right coalitions and voters tiring of both hard right and left. Lula may struggle to win a fourth term.

Entity/Subject: More of America's forces leaving Europe, Asia and the Middle East
Expected Impact/Value: Part of Trump's impulse that America is uniquely powerful and 'doesn't need them'.
Requires support of parliamentary moderates. Lecornu must suspend Macron's pension reform while keeping centre-right support. Failure could lead to a political crisis.

Key Player/Organization: Emmanuel Macron, Marine Le Pen's National Rally (RN)
Expected Impact/Value: If Macron fails to secure budget, political pressure to dissolve parliament and hold fresh legislative elections becomes irresistible. Polls suggest RN and allies could secure 250 seats, claiming the right to govern (Jordan Bardella as PM), leading to a spell of deepened uncertainty and potential civil disorder.
Will rise to 350,000 rounds a year (up from 25,000 rounds in 2025), aiming to be 'the largest ammunition plant in Europe, if not the world'.
Cumulative increase of €700bn-€800bn.
Aiming for €40bn-€50bn, which would catapult it into the big American league.
Will pick up a bit, driven by consumers slowly spending more as economic uncertainty subsides, and increased defence spending. Eurozone projected modest uptick to 1.2% (from 0.8% in 2025).
Around 5% of GDP; struggling to close it. Runs risk of a fiscal crisis but supports growth in the short term.
Subdued, ticking down to 2.4%. American tariffs, geopolitical strife, and policy uncertainty will hold back investment and trade.

Entity/Subject: Tariffs boosting America's underlying annual inflation rate
Expected Impact/Value: Inflation rate likely boosted by about one percentage point, potentially making the Fed reluctant to cut interest rates as much as markets hope.

Key Player/Organization: Jerome Powell (current chair, due to step down in May 2026), Chris Waller (likely replacement), Donald Trump
Expected Impact/Value: Could set off a succession drama, casting doubt on the central bank's long-term inflation-fighting credibility if Trump chooses a partisan replacement. Powell may stay on as governor until 2028 to preserve independence.
Not in source (The decision was based on it costing 3.69 cents to make each penny in 2024, costing $85m a year).

Entity/Subject: Geothermal power supply to the grid (largest-ever commercial contract)
Expected Impact/Value: Fervo is contracted to supply 320 megawatts of power to Southern California Edison. Marks the start of the great geothermal renaissance.

Entity/Subject: Five-yearly review of the Trade and Co-operation Agreement (Brexit deal)
Key Player/Organization: Britain (Sir Keir Starmer's Labour government), European Union
Timeline: 2026 (anniversary of referendum and moment for review)
Expected Impact/Value: Sir Keir's government is pursuing pragmatic ways to move closer to the EU, potentially by aligning with EU food and phytosanitary standards, and signing up to common energy and environmental rules, bolstered by geopolitical necessity (Russia, Trump, Middle East tensions).

Entity/Subject: EU trade agreements (Mercosur, Indonesia, India, UAE)
Key Player/Organization: European Union, Mercosur, Indonesia, India, UAE
Timeline: Early 2026 (hopes for India and UAE deals)
Expected Impact/Value: Countries racing to lock in long-term access through free-trade agreements due to Trump's tariffs. EU sealed a deal with Indonesia and hopes to do the same with India and the UAE by early 2026.

Entity/Subject: Christopher Nolan's version of Homer's 'The Odyssey'
Expected Impact/Value: Hollywood epic, presented as a parable for the modern age with lessons on war, mass migration, and technology.

Entity/Subject: Artemis II mission (sending astronauts around the Moon)
Expected Impact/Value: Second flight of the Space Launch System (SLS) and first with crew aboard Orion spacecraft; a ten-day mission to test spacecraft/life-support, paving the way for Artemis III (crewed lunar landing).

Entity/Subject: Launch of Haven 1 (world's first commercial space station)
Key Player/Organization: Vast (startup based in Long Beach, California)
Timeline: May 2026 (launch date); first crew launch a few months later (spend two weeks)
Expected Impact/Value: Habitable volume of 45 cubic metres, available for government/private-sector use; host four missions total, intended to be in orbit for three years. Positioned as a replacement for the ISS after 2030.

Timeline: 2026 (hopes to make its most ambitious move; Earth and Mars lined up for launch)
Expected Impact/Value: Not in source (if he misses it, next opportunity is 2028).
Consists of an orbiter, lander, rover, and scout spacecraft. Lander will touch down on Shackleton crater rim to investigate permanent shadows nearby, gathering data for a future lunar base.

Key Player/Organization: Viktor Orban (Fidesz party), Peter Magyar (Tisza party)
Expected Impact/Value: Orban's first serious electoral challenge in over a decade; if he loses, it could help unblock the EU from his repeated vetoes on sanctions and Ukraine talks. Provides lessons on strongman incumbents facing electoral challenges in hollowed-out democracies.
New target set at 3.5% of GDP (up from 2%). Germany has laid out a path to use deficit exemption to hit the new target as early as 2029.

Entity/Subject: EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) enforcement
Expected Impact/Value: Imposes tariffs on carbon-intensive imports. Meeting resistance; calls to water it down, particularly if the hard-right National Rally wins a parliamentary election in France.

Timeline: April 2026 (officials collect data on every dwelling)
Expected Impact/Value: Colossal undertaking, unusually important due to 16-year delay. Forms bedrock of policymaking; fresh figures should enable vast improvement in targeting welfare schemes, services, and infrastructure.

Expected to redistribute seats (and potentially increase their number). Would enable cities (economic engines) to demand more attention/funding, and cede political power from richer southern states to poorer, more populous north. Pundits say this would cement dominance of Modi's party.

Entity/Subject: India overtakes Japan as world's fourth-largest economy (in financial year close)
Timeline: Early 2026 (By the close of the financial year in March)
Expected Impact/Value: Milestone showing tremendous progress (was not in top ten at start of century). IMF reckons it will trail only America and China by 2030.
Will exceed 110%.

Key Player/Organization: Binyamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), hard-right and ultra-religious parties
Expected Impact/Value: Netanyahu's bloc is trailing in polls, but he can dictate the security agenda to his benefit. If he cannot convince voters he won in Gaza, he will try to distract them with a culture war over Israel's democracy.

Entity/Subject: Lucas Museum of Narrative Art opening
Expected Impact/Value: Will house auteur's art collection and archive (40,000 objects), including paintings, comic strips, storyboards, models, and costumes. A 'temple' to stories told through illustration.

Entity/Subject: Guggenheim outpost in Abu Dhabi opening
Expected Impact/Value: Will consider modernism from a global perspective; collection includes works by Yayoi Kusama and Monir Shahroudy Farmanfarmaian.
Located in a former Citroën garage in Brussels; focus on 20th and 21st-century art and will host spoken-word nights, film screenings, and concerts to boost attendance.

Entity/Subject: Golden Dome missile-defence shield (plan comes into sharper focus)
Key Player/Organization: Donald Trump (US President), US Space Force
Timeline: 2026 (Trump's vision may come into sharper focus)
Expected Impact/Value: Requires a 40% boost for the US Space Force in the 2026 fiscal year budget request. Possible construction of new interceptors or plans for space-based lasers (both hugely expensive).

Bukele will consolidate his dictatorship, facing no international check due to Trump's backing. Likely to become more brazen in repression, with observers watching economic stability (IMF loan may entail spending cuts) and whether popularity falls (currently around 80%).

Entity/Subject: Mass deportation campaign (Phase 2, groundwork laid in 2025)
Key Player/Organization: Donald Trump administration, Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
Expected Impact/Value: A dollop of cash from the One Big Beautiful Bill Act will fund more immigration agents, detention centres, removal flights, and surveillance tech. Old prisons/tent camps will reopen/be built. Raids and arrests will become common in Democrat-run cities. Potential labour shock (worries about ICE raids keeping workers home).

Key Player/Organization: Ahmed al-Sharaa (Syria's new leader), Washington hawks
Expected Impact/Value: Syria's new leader has staked political capital on this. International banks are on standby and export agreements are being readied. However, little rebuilding has happened, and pace is glacial. Sharaa needs to deliver tangible change or risk turning people against him.
Grows by less than 2% as American protectionism affects industries.
Expanding by 15% globally (to 24m), with China accounting for over half. American anti-green turn stalls new electric models plans for other carmakers. American EV sales will rise by just 2%.

Entity/Subject: Big sporting events (men's football World Cup in North America, Winter Olympics/Paralympics)
Expected Impact/Value: Push sports spending to $450bn, lift ad revenues by 6%, and add to the $1.8trn spent on tourism.
Climb by 7%, with nickel, copper, and zinc among the beneficiaries. 'Green' steel (recycling scrap) also in demand. Nickel prices will rise by 13%.
Hits $2.9trn, with America alone shelling out over $1trn.
Increase to $1.6trn, swelled by obesity drugs.
Grows by just 2% as consumer confidence wobbles amid global uncertainty. Online shops hurt by tariffs, chilling demand for warehouse space.

Entity/Subject: Renewable energy share of power generation (excluding hydropower)
Expected Impact/Value: Makes up 30% of power generation worldwide, surpassing coal's share.
EU will also impose carbon border-adjustment rules. California will compel climate reporting, but anti-green sentiment will rule in many US states.

Entity/Subject: Proportion of Japan's population over 65 years old
Expected Impact/Value: Reaches a landmark as those over 65 exceed 30% of the population (Japan has nearly three times as many oldies as children).

Entity/Subject: America (with Argentina) quits the World Health Organisation (WHO)
Expected Impact/Value: Slashing WHO funds by 15%. AIDS programmes and childhood vaccinations could stall, allowing diseases to proliferate.

Entity/Subject: Gross fixed investment (proxy for infrastructure spending)
Expected Impact/Value: Will rise by 6% to over $30trn. Nearly half of spending will be in Asia.

Entity/Subject: Golden Globes accept nominations for 'best podcast'
Expected Impact/Value: Recognizing the rise of canned radio; podcast-ad spending expected to exceed $5.5bn (WARC Media forecast).
Over 2,500 are set to open.
Shortfall of 90,000 trained seafarers due to Russians/Ukrainians fighting and geopolitical tensions making the profession less alluring.

Entity/Subject: EU's strict AI Act enters into full force
Expected Impact/Value: Regulators will struggle to keep pace with technology's progress.

Entity/Subject: Workers trained to work with AI needed
Expected Impact/Value: India alone will need 1m workers trained to work with AI. Cognizant pledges to train 1m people globally.
Could boost computing speeds by 10-15%. TSMC will hasten to open its second facility in America.
A record 2bn international travellers will spend $1.8trn. A quarter of them hailing from China and America.
Will rise by just 2%, curbed by border controls and high prices, although football fans may flock to the World Cup in North America.

Entity/Subject: Start of regular cargo service through the Northern Sea Route (NSR)
Timeline: 2026 (South Korea says it will start testing the route)
Expected Impact/Value: Increased interest in the shorter, seasonal NSR if the Red Sea route via the Suez Canal remains risky due to Houthi attacks.
Provides deep-water docking close to the increasingly frequented Bering Strait, improving prospects for the Graphite One project (graphite mine nearby).
Likely to fall by nearly a percentage point, making housebuilders feel more buoyant, and contributing to the economy picking up a little.
Will probably grow more slowly, possibly suffering from 'payback' (as consumers refrain from replacing goods bought in 2025 with subsidies), potentially falling below pre-subsidy level.
Will slow but not stumble. Trade war will determine how China meets its growth targets, not whether it meets them. Property market may bottom out.
Potential for Marwan Barghouti to defeat Hamas at the ballot box, prompting a handover of power in Gaza/West Bank and reconstruction might finally begin.

Entity/Subject: Non-aggression pact between Syria and Israel
Expected Impact/Value: Syria would sign to curtail Israel's encroachments on its territory. Harder for Lebanon to go that far.

Entity/Subject: Political deal in place for a digital euro
Expected Impact/Value: Sets the stage for the currency to be launched by around 2029 (public, euro-denominated alternative to privately issued stablecoins).

Timeline: End of 2026 (hope to have this many)
Expected Impact/Value: Hopes to have 10,000 of its Neo robots (costing $20,000 each) in homes around the world, despite current limitations, in order to gather training data about the real world.

Last treaty limiting long-range nuclear weapons expires. A nuclear free-for-all beckons, as there will not be enough time to renegotiate a new one. Best hope is an informal extension, possibly without verification measures.

Entity/Subject: Adjustment to the exchange-rate regime (peso flotation)
Expected Impact/Value: Adjustment likely to boost growth and investment, make it easier for the government to accumulate foreign reserves, and give markets confidence to lend to Argentina again.
Crucial to the country's long-term debt sustainability.

Entity/Subject: Passing of structural reforms (labor laws liberalization, tax system simplification, budget locking in fiscal surplus)
Timeline: 2026 (likely to get Congress approval after concessions)
Expected Impact/Value: If reforms are made, 2026 could be a very good year for Milei. Macroeconomic normality would be achieved.

Entity/Subject: Western efforts to reduce dependence on China (investment/supply chains)
Key Player/Organization: America's Defence Department, mp Materials, Lynas (Australian producer), Hastings Technology, Wyloo, ABB, Noveon Magnetics, Apple
Expected Impact/Value: Lynas will invest in a processing plant in Malaysia. Apple committed $500m partnership with mp Materials to make magnets from recycled rare earths. Despite efforts, America still relies on China for four-fifths of its rare-earth needs. Daido Steel/Honda have developed heavy rare-earth-free magnets for hybrid-vehicle motors.

Entity/Subject: Enhanced Games (sporting event where performance-enhancing drugs are permitted)
Key Player/Organization: Aron D'Souza, Peter Thiel, Christian Angermayer (backers)
Timeline: May 21st to 24th, 2026 (inaugural event in Las Vegas)
Expected Impact/Value: Features swimming, track, and weightlifting. Prize money of $500,000 per event, $1m bonus for world record. Will double as marketing for a planned direct-to-consumer telehealth platform (launching in 2026). Lawsuit filed against World Aquatics for $800m for alleged antitrust/boycott.

Entity/Subject: Global Carbon Budget (remaining tonnes of CO2 for 50% chance of staying under 1.5°C threshold)
Expected Impact/Value: At current emissions rate (42bn tonnes a year), 1.5°C threshold will have been exceeded by the end of 2027 (33% chance it will be exceeded by end of 2026). World will fail to meet Paris agreement target, conclusion of a post-1.5°C world seems inescapable.

Entity/Subject: Arrival of world's first officially recognised climate refugees (from Tuvalu)
Expected Impact/Value: Up to 280 Tuvaluans can permanently migrate to Australia each year. Treaty redefines Tuvaluan sovereignty (retaining UN vote/vast economic zone even if territory is lost to rising seas). Unintended consequence: accelerating brain drain for Tuvalu.

Entity/Subject: China's 'anaconda' strategy (squeezing Taiwan, short of invasion)
Expected Impact/Value: Expected to intensify and expand, involving drones over the main island, aircraft-carrier strike groups venturing around the island, and surreptitious disruption of undersea communication cables (mimicking Russian sabotage). Focus on slow, steady, invidious process of creeping dominance.

Entity/Subject: Adoption of AI 'agents' in business apps
Expected Impact/Value: 40% of apps businesses use to improve workflows will incorporate AI 'agents' (up from 5% in mid-2025), replacing or working alongside humans.
